result.execSummary:
The defendant Israel Santos-Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable court costs, fees and supervision fees during period of probation. If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
No violent contact with his children, no belts or other instruments to be used as punishment.

Successfully complete an anger management course.
Complete a parenting class.
Absolute sobriety--no illegal drug or alcohol.
Random urine screens.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED until next court date of 12-5-14
***12-05-14, Judge Dallet, Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time for non-compliance with the conditions of probation. FORTHWITH.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Israel Santos-Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez not in court.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
  Court ordered defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with 175 days credit for time served.
.
COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 45 in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, STAYED until next court date.
-Successfully complete an anger management course.
-Complete a parenting class.
-No violent contact with his children, no belts or other instruments to be used as punishment.
-AODA assessment and treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drug or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-Maintain full time employment.  
-Pay all applicable court costs, fees and supervision fees during period of probation.  If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas in court, defendant Israel Santos-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and defense would like a little more time.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez in court with attorney Ronnie I Vargas.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Physical Abuse of a Child (Reckless Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ronnie I Vargas in court, defendant Israel Santos-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-12-2014 at 01:30 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 06-23-2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Ronnie I Vargas in court, defendant Israel Santos-Martinez not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.  Case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDED 04/16/2014.
Sworn as interpreter:  ALEXANDRIA WIRTH.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with I.S-M. (12/13/2005), UNLESS THE CONTACT IS APPROVED BY THE BMCW.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Israel Santos-Martinez in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
